title: Password manager truncates the site address to an unusable address
content:
I try to enter a new site & password with a long address. Manager truncates it to a simple dot com which brings up a "403 - Forbidden: Access is denied." error message. I have a bookmark that takes me to the correct login page, but Manager doesn't recognize it and won't suggest a login for it. For example: this page url is "https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new/desktop/form" PassManager would truncate this to "https://support.mozilla.org" If I try to submit a new password, in the manager, it tells me there is already a site EVEN IF I HAVE DELETED THAT FAULTY SITE. This is a real problem and it happens on more than one site which makes the manager a limited feature. Unfortunately that makes my preference in using a Mozilla product (rather than Roboform etc) a distinct liability. Please give this some thought, thank you.

I would also like to see the manager remember the answers to secondary security questions on some websites login pages, if that were possible.
creator: GomerF

title: Bookmark Manager - how to copy & paste bookmarks from text file
content:
It is great that one can copy and paste a list of URL's from a text file into a new bookmark manager 'folder'. This feature is very useful for sharing lists of URL's with a study group, for example. However, the URL appears in the 'Name' field as well as the 'Location' field and this is sometimes unhelpful.

Is there a way I can format the text file with 'Name', 'Tags' and 'Location' fields separated, so that the list can be copied and pasted correctly. Commas and spaces don't seem to work.
creator: dwurkin

title: every time I open mozilla after closing it, it asks me to log back into gmail

Whenever I open a new link the multi-account-containers extension keep asking me which container I want to open this link but I don't want it to interrupt me every time I will switch to a container if I wish don't ask me again and again to select.

How can I turn the always ask setting I don't see an option
creator: areeburrub

title: Whatsappweb - chat - how download names and phones
content:
Hello everyone! I use Firefox 102.12.0esr (64 bit) on my Macbook and I would like to download the names and phones of the chats I’ve joined on Whatsapp.

It can be done by hand and by taking screenshots (of course), but if there are dozens of contacts it is a problem. :(

On the net I've found that with a Chrome extension you can do it (I assume) easily, but -if possible- I'd like to avoid Chrome which I really don't like. ... but if there are no alternatives .... I’ll make a virtue of necessity!

So I ask if anyone knows and has already done this with Firefox. I specify that I haven't found anything suitable in the list of FF extensions (I use an almost "clean" FF, ie I only have three or four add-ons).

Off-thread comment Despite assuming that FF is still one of the most widespread and popular browsers - updates of even the most important extensions and add-ons always lag behind FF updates or even this items aren’t updated at all. I fear that this aspect will lead to a progressive shift from FF to Chrome and obviously this is a pity (even if I'm not a compulsive user of extensions!!). Don’t you agree? (Sorry for this complaint!)

Looking forward to your suggestions about my request. Thank you very much
creator: ociciornie

title: Star+ Quality
content: Hello, I have been using Firefox for a month and I had no problems until I started using Star+ which does not give me the quality and seems almost like a pirate site, I have tried everything from clearing the cache, to disable hardware acceleration but nothing seems to work, I tried other browsers like Edge or Chrome and if they give me the maximum quality at 60fps that gives the Star+ page. I don't know if it's a specific issue with Firefox since it's not based on the same engine or something like that but it's quite annoying not being able to get the quality I'm looking for in this browser.
creator: dahirsantamaria.03

title: Backup Codes Not Working (Backup authentication code not found)
content:
I added 2FA to my account on 10 October 2021, and recently bought a new phone with a fresh Authenticator app. I have all my backup codes saved already so I thought it wouldn't be any worries.

I was wrong, I've been facing this error for all the 10 different codes: Backup authentication code not found

I only have one Firefox account with 2FA, so I'm 100% confident this is the right account. I have access to my email associated with the locked out Firefox account and I can see the email mentioning that I activated 2FA on 10 October 2021, and there are no emails beyond that regarding my 2FA.

I am a developer who have published Firefox Addons - so I am not able to just create a new account, I need this account specifically.

I have the following info:

  • Email
  • Password
  • Backup codes (that don't work, I can provide screenshot of the codes upon request)
  • Gmail Access associated with the Firefox account

Help really appreciated, Tomas
creator: tompatomp

title: Did a clean install, bookmarks gone
content:
To resolve an issue that has been plaguing me, I did a clean install of Firefox. I followed some instructions I found on here that ensured that all I had to do was rename the existing Firefox folder to something else, download and run the installer again, and I should have done a clean install without losing my user data.

The issue I had has been fixed, but all of my add-ons and bookmarks are gone. I can get the add-ons back, but where can I find the bookmarks in the old Firefox folder?
creator: TheNobleShade

title: Drag tab to bookmark folder timeout
content: I see this question was raised back in 2019, but the solution didn't really solve the issue very cleanly. Wanted to check and see if any new options have become available since then. My preferred method of bookmarking new pages is to drag them into nested folders for ease of organization and finding them later. However, the bookmark menus are extremely sensitive to cursor placement and close VERY quickly if you accidentally go outside the boundaries. Is there a way to slow that down so it's less fussy? Thank you. Running Windows 10 and FF 114.0.1 64 bit.
